biography:
M83 is a French electronic/shoegaze band from Antibes, formed in 2001 by Anthony Gonzalez and Nicolas Fromageau. The band is named after the spiral galaxy Messier 83, and its musical aesthetic is influenced by shoegaze in its extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instrumentals, although M83's songs employ considerably less guitar than most shoegaze bands.
Gonzalez and Fromageau parted ways shortly after touring for their second album Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts, with Gonzalez now recording primarily on his own, often with the help of his brother Yann Gonzalez, vocalist/keyboardist Morgan Kibby, and drummer Lo√Øc Maurin. In 2011, Gonzalez posted an open audition on the M83 website for a multi-instrumentalist who could join the band. 19 year-old Jordan Lawlor won the audition.
name: M83

discogs.name: M83
discogs.profile: Electronica and shoegaze band from Antibes, France, fronted by Anthony Gonzalez. Formed in 1999, they released their first album in 2001. Nicolas Fromageau left in 2004.

raw_data.lastfm: ArtistLastFmData(name='M83', url='https://www.last.fm/music/M83', mbid='6d7b7cd4-254b-4c25-83f6-dd20f98ceacd', listeners=3188450, playcount=123599511, bio_summary='M83 is a French-American electronic music project formed in Antibes, Alpes-Maritimes in 2001 and currently based in Los Angeles, United States. The band's primary member is vocalist, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer Anthony Gonzalez. The band was initially formed as a duo also with Nicolas Fromageau; it has released eight albums and three soundtracks, including the Grammy Award-nominated Hurry Up, We're Dreaming. Gonzalez and Fromageau parted ways shortly after touring their second album Dead Cities Read more on Last.fm', bio_content='M83 is a French-American electronic music project formed in Antibes, Alpes-Maritimes in 2001 and currently based in Los Angeles, United States. The band's primary member is vocalist, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer Anthony Gonzalez. The band was initially formed as a duo also with Nicolas Fromageau; it has released eight albums and three soundtracks, including the Grammy Award-nominated Hurry Up, We're Dreaming. Gonzalez and Fromageau parted ways shortly after touring their second album Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts. Gonzalez records primarily on his own, with other artists as guest musicians. The band is signed to Mute Records and found international success in 2011 with the single "Midnight City". Their most recent album Fantasy was released on 17 March 2023. Anthony Gerard Gonzalez (born March 13, 1980) grew up in Antibes, France together with his brother Yann. His family had a great interest in football and Gonzalez had trials with AS Cannes, while his maternal grandfather is the French international Laurent Robuschi. At the age of 14 he got injured and turned to music instead after his parents bought him a guitar. Gonzalez developed his interest in music and American culture while at secondary school. Together with Fromageau he formed a post-rock outfit called My Violent Wish. At the age of 17, Gonzalez bought a synth to record a demo, which he sent to a number of French labels. When the Paris-based Gooom Records appeared interested, he recruited Fromageau to "help me because I didn't feel like I had the shoulders to carry the project on my own". The band is named after the galaxy of the same name. The band's musical aesthetic is characterized by extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instruments. Gonzalez has been inspired by aspects of the American Dream and his songs have been outlined as themed around "adult-scripted teen dreams". Inspiration for the 1980s style found in much of Gonzalez‚Äôs music includes bands such as My Bloody Valentine, Pink Floyd, and Tangerine Dream. Between various electronic music properties and album artwork, M83‚Äôs style includes a mix of both contemporary pop and 1980s dream pop. Read more on Last.fm. theaudiodb.biography_en:
M83 is a French electronic/shoegaze band from Antibes, formed in 2001 by Anthony Gonzalez and Nicolas Fromageau. The band is named after the spiral galaxy Messier 83, and its musical aesthetic is influenced by shoegaze in its extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instrumentals, although M83's songs employ considerably less guitar than most shoegaze bands.
Gonzalez and Fromageau parted ways shortly after touring for their second album Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts, with Gonzalez now recording primarily on his own, often with the help of his brother Yann Gonzalez, vocalist/keyboardist Morgan Kibby, and drummer Lo√Øc Maurin. In 2011, Gonzalez posted an open audition on the M83 website for a multi-instrumentalist who could join the band. 19 year-old Jordan Lawlor won the audition.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
M83 est un groupe de musique √©lectronique fran√ßais, originaire d'Antibes et tr√®s populaire aux √âtats-Unis. Actif depuis 19992, le groupe √©tait compos√© √† l'origine d'Anthony Gonzalez et Nicolas Fromageau. Apr√®s la tourn√©e de Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts, Nicolas Fromageau a quitt√© le groupe en 2004 et a fond√© en 2009 le groupe Team Ghost.

Fond√© en 1999 dans un lyc√©e d'Antibes, le groupe M83 est originellement compos√© d'Anthony Gonzalez et de Nicolas Fromageau.
La galaxie M83 a donn√© son nom au groupe.
Au printemps 2001, M83 enregistre un premier album √©ponyme. Ils rencontrent le succ√®s critique international avec leur deuxi√®me album intitul√© Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts, sorti au printemps 2003 (et √† l'√©t√© 2004 en Am√©rique du Nord). √Ä l'issue de leur tourn√©e mondiale qui accompagne la sortie de l'album, Nicolas Fromageau quitte le groupe, il fondera plus tard Team Ghost.
Apr√®s s'√™tre tourn√© vers le label Mute, Anthony Gonzalez retourne au studio pour enregistrer le troisi√®me album intitul√© Before the Dawn Heals Us, sorti en janvier 2005. La m√™me ann√©e, M83 r√©alise un remix de The Pioneers de Bloc Party, inclus dans l'album de remixes de Bloc Party, Silent Alarm Remixed. M83 remixe √©galement les titres Prot√®ge-Moi de Placebo, Black Cherry de Goldfrapp, Suffer Well de Depeche Mode et Vila Attack du groupe Bumblebeez 81.
En 2006, apr√®s la tourn√©e aux √âtats-Unis pour la sortie de Before the Dawn Heals Us, Anthony Gonzalez enregistre une collection de titres dans une veine plus Ambient. Ces titres sont enregistr√©s dans son home studio avec l'aide d'Antoine Gaillet. Ce projet appel√© Digital Shades Vol. 1 fait l'objet d'un album qui sort en septembre 2007, avec une pochette illustr√©e par Laurent Fetis (connu pour son travail pour des artistes tels que DJ Hell, Beck, et Tahiti 80).
Le cinqui√®me album, Saturdays = Youth, sort en avril 2008. Il est enregistr√© avec Ken Thomas (qui a travaill√© pour Sigur R√≥s, The Sugarcubes, Boys in a Band, Cocteau Twins et Suede), Ewan Pearson (qui a produit Tracey Thorn, The Rapture et Ladytron) et Morgan Kibby (du groupe The Romanovs). La tonalit√© de l'album est clairement influenc√©e par les ann√©es 1980. Le titre We Own The Sky sera choisi pour ouvrir le film de snowboard That‚Äôs It That‚Äôs All (r√©alis√© en 2008 par Curt Morgan, avec entre autres les riders Travis Rice et Nicolas M√ºller).

En 2010 la bande originale du film L'Autre Monde de Gilles Marchand int√®gre certaines chansons du groupe (In the Cold I'm Standing, Farewell Goodbye, Facing That et Violet Tree) ainsi que deux in√©dits (Black Hole et Marions's Theme).

Le magazine Pitchfork lui attribue la note de 9,1 sur 10, et en fait l'un des album de l'ann√©e.

Cette utilisation, qui co√Øncide avec une tourn√©e fran√ßaise, a pour effet d'engendrer un ph√©nom√®ne particulier, puisque les ventes du single atteignent en France des scores importants en quelques semaines; ce ph√©nom√®ne est renforc√© par l‚Äôutilisation de la chanson, √† l'automne, dans une publicit√© et fort de tout ceci, Midnight City se retrouve alors class√© parmi les meilleures ventes de singles, et ce un an apr√®s sa sortie, alors qu'initialement, ce titre n'avait connu qu'un succ√®s d'estime sur le territoire fran√ßais.
Reunion est le deuxi√®me single extrait de l'album, la vid√©o est l√† encore r√©alis√©e par Fleur & Manu et constitue une suite au clip de Midnight City. discogs.profile: Electronica and shoegaze band from Antibes, France, fronted by Anthony Gonzalez. Formed in 1999, they released their first album in 2001. Nicolas Fromageau left in 2004.

raw_data.name: M83
raw_data.profile: Electronica and shoegaze band from Antibes, France, fronted by Anthony Gonzalez. Formed in 1999, they released their first album in 2001. Nicolas Fromageau left in 2004.

lastfm.bio_content: M83 is a French-American electronic music project formed in Antibes, Alpes-Maritimes in 2001 and currently based in Los Angeles, United States. The band's primary member is vocalist, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer Anthony Gonzalez. The band was initially formed as a duo also with Nicolas Fromageau; it has released eight albums and three soundtracks, including the Grammy Award-nominated Hurry Up, We're Dreaming. Gonzalez and Fromageau parted ways shortly after touring their second album Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts. Gonzalez records primarily on his own, with other artists as guest musicians. The band is signed to Mute Records and found international success in 2011 with the single "Midnight City". Their most recent album Fantasy was released on 17 March 2023. Anthony Gerard Gonzalez (born March 13, 1980) grew up in Antibes, France together with his brother Yann. His family had a great interest in football and Gonzalez had trials with AS Cannes, while his maternal grandfather is the French international Laurent Robuschi. At the age of 14 he got injured and turned to music instead after his parents bought him a guitar. Gonzalez developed his interest in music and American culture while at secondary school. Together with Fromageau he formed a post-rock outfit called My Violent Wish. At the age of 17, Gonzalez bought a synth to record a demo, which he sent to a number of French labels. When the Paris-based Gooom Records appeared interested, he recruited Fromageau to "help me because I didn't feel like I had the shoulders to carry the project on my own". The band is named after the galaxy of the same name. The band's musical aesthetic is characterized by extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instruments. Gonzalez has been inspired by aspects of the American Dream and his songs have been outlined as themed around "adult-scripted teen dreams". Inspiration for the 1980s style found in much of Gonzalez‚Äôs music includes bands such as My Bloody Valentine, Pink Floyd, and Tangerine Dream. Between various electronic music properties and album artwork, M83‚Äôs style includes a mix of both contemporary pop and 1980s dream pop. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

theaudiodb.biography_en:
M83 is a French electronic/shoegaze band from Antibes, formed in 2001 by Anthony Gonzalez and Nicolas Fromageau. The band is named after the spiral galaxy Messier 83, and its musical aesthetic is influenced by shoegaze in its extensive use of reverb effects and lyrics spoken softly over loud instrumentals, although M83's songs employ considerably less guitar than most shoegaze bands.
Gonzalez and Fromageau parted ways shortly after touring for their second album Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts, with Gonzalez now recording primarily on his own, often with the help of his brother Yann Gonzalez, vocalist/keyboardist Morgan Kibby, and drummer Lo√Øc Maurin. In 2011, Gonzalez posted an open audition on the M83 website for a multi-instrumentalist who could join the band. 19 year-old Jordan Lawlor won the audition.
